voice_transcription: I can make an omelette, but I cannot cook pizza Margherita; that is beyond my skills. I have salt, sugar, brown rice, and a biscuit that I think is Argentinian called "afocados" or something like that.
comment: description of ingredient without naming it with confidence

voice_transcription: Umm... I have... let me see... eggs, uh, some chicken breast, and... wait... yeah, butter and... oh! garlic. I think I can make... hmm... pasta carbonara.
I got eggs milk cheese and also I know how to cook the scrambled eggs and also pancakes but not the fancy ones just regular
comment: run-on sentence without punctuation or pauses

voice_transcription: I can make stir-fry veggies, I have those long orange things, you know, the crunchy ones, and also that leafy green stuff that looks like small trees.
comment: multiple ingredient descriptions without proper names

voice_transcription: Remove pasta carbonara. Remove eggs. Actually wait, keep the eggs, I do have those.
Je peux faire... sorry, I can make omelette and I have des oeufs— I mean eggs and fromage... cheese.
I have chicken, tomatos— I mean tomatoes, and I can cook stake frites.
So like basically I'm pretty good at making that Italian pasta thing with the bacon and eggs? And I've got like some dairy stuff and meat in the fridge obvs.
comment: informal speech patterns and vague descriptions

voice_transcription: I HAVE EGGS AND BUTTER AND MILK! Oh sorry, didn't mean to yell. I can make pancakes and french toast.
My roommate bought some vegetables yesterday but I'm not sure what exactly, maybe broccoli? And I think I can cook curry if I look up a recipe online.
comment: uncertainty about inventory and conditional cooking ability

voice_transcription: I've got about half a bottle of olive oil, maybe three or four eggs, and some chicken from last week.
comment: container-based quantity with temporal and approximate count

voice_transcription: There's a big bag of rice in the pantry, a small piece of ginger, and I think medium-sized onions, like two of them.
I have that white soft cheese, you know, the one that comes in a tub? And some of that hard yellow cheese for grating.
There's a bottle of soy sauce, a jar of peanut butter, and a packet of instant noodles.

voice_transcription: I've got more than enough pasta, less than half a carton of milk, and about a quarter stick of butter left.
I have some Heinz ketchup, Philadelphia cream cheese, and Barilla spaghetti.

voice_transcription: There's cooked rice from yesterday, raw chicken thighs, and I think some blanched broccoli in a container.

I've got leftover chicken, some pizza from the weekend, and half a pot of soup.
There are some veggies in the crisper, various spices in the cabinet, and a few different cheeses.

voice_transcription: The lettuce is kinda old but still okay, the strawberries are pretty fresh, and the bread is getting a bit stale.
I have half an onion wrapped in the fridge, a quarter of a rotisserie chicken, and like three-quarters of a bell pepper.
There are those summer tomatoes I got from the farmer's market, some French cheese my friend brought back, and Italian pasta.
I've got chicken in the freezer, canned beans in the pantry, and fresh herbs on the counter.

voice_transcription: There's enough rice for two meals, one serving of salmon left, and maybe pasta for three dinners.
